learning_outcomes.description: Articulate the key concepts and principles in the law of torts.
Engage thoughtfully with case law and statutes.
Analyse facts and identify legal solutions to the problems raised by those facts.

assessments.task_description:
The examination is a closed book examination conducted via Learn.UQ during the lecture time in week 5.

The examination will consist of a number of multiple choice questions totalling 40 marks.

Students will need to bring with them an electronic device - iPad, Surface Pro or laptop computer which is set up and able to connect to the University's wi-fi network.

Please ensure that prior to entering the examination venue, you log onto the University network (using double factor authentication) and that your device is fully charged.

Students may only access the exam questions during the examÂ - not notes, websites or any external materials of any type.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The exam will be conducted via Learn.UQ.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
The end-of-semester exam will be conducted during the central exam block. Any written or printed material is permitted in the exam; material may also be annotated.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of Generative AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct Policy.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(23 Feb - 31 May)
learning_activities.topic:
Lectures

The lecture topics are:

  1. Torts: An Overview/Intentional Torts I
  2. Intentional Torts Against the Person Problem Solvi
  3. Trespass to Land
  4. Nuisance
  5. Negligence 1- The Duty of Care
  6. Negligence 2 - Breach of Duty
  7. Negligence 3 - Causation and Remoteness of Damage
  8. Negligence 4 - Multiple Tortfeasors
  9. Negligence 5 - Defences
  10. Actions on Death

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Lectures The lecture topics are: Torts: An Overview/Intentional Torts I Intentional Torts Against the Person Problem Solvi Trespass to Land Nuisance Negligence 1- The Duty of Care Negligence 2 - Breach of Duty Negligence 3 - Causation and Remoteness of Damage Negligence 4 - Multiple Tortfeasors Negligence 5 - Defences Actions on Death

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 12(23 Feb - 24 May)
learning_activities.topic:
Tutorials

The tutorial topics are:

  1. Torts: An Overview
  2. Intentional Torts Against the Person Problem Solvi
  3. Intentional Torts Against the Person
  4. False Imprisonment - Case Reading Exercise
  5. Negligence Overview
  6. Negligence 2 - Breach of Duty
  7. Negligence 3 - Causation and Remoteness of Damage
  8. Negligence 4 - Multiple Tortfeasors
  9. Negligence 5 - Defences
  10. Revision

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
